message: This conversation is reserved for discussion around the Google Summer of Code 2011 backend framework implementation.

Here's a link to the PyOpenCL computing library, Compyte:


https://github.com/inducer/compyte

James Bergstra also mentioned the new GPUArray object that is being worked on:

http://lists.tiker.net/listinfo/gpundarray

Dan Farmer provided some PyOpenCL lecture links, for those who want to get up to speed quickly:

Lecture 1  - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X9mflbX1NL8 (Intro stuff)
Lecture 2 - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MqvfCE_bKOg (PyOpenCL)
Lecture 3 - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TAvKmV7CuUw (Code generation)
Lecture 4 - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SsuJ0LvZW1Q (Multi-GPU, PyCUDA)

Finally, Pieter--this year's GSOC student--has a blog up at:

http://pythonimaging.blogspot.com
